description.description: Overrides the name specified in the template.json

id.description: The id of the symbol from the template.json.

name.description: Overrides the name specified in the template.json

persistenceScope.description: Determines if the user entered values should be persisted for the next template invocation.

requiredComponent.description: To require a particular host version specify the hostId and optionally version only. To require a particular SetupComponent or Extension, specify the ID and set the componentType appropriately. Version range is optional.

hostId.description: The host id that the component applies to

version.description: A version range specifying the required version range. This uses the nuget package format.

choices.description: Specifies the name and description overrides for individual choice parameters

defaultValue.description: Overrides the default value specified for the

invertBoolean.description: If the referenced symbol should be shown in the IDE.

isVisible.description: Should be shown in the IDE. If not specified, defaults value is the value specified by defaultSymbolVisibility.

persistenceScope.description: Determines if the user entered value should be persisted and used the next time a template is selected. Default value is the value specified by defaultSymbolVisibility Used starting in Visual Studio 2022 17.3

persistenceScopeName.description: Specifies the scope name of the persisted template option. To avoid conflicts with other templates, treat this like a namespace. Used starting in Visual Studio 2022 17.3

remove.description: Tags to remove. * can be specified to remove all tags specified in template.json

version.description: A version range specifying the unsupported host versions. This uses the nuget package format.

defaultPersistenceScope.description: The dafault value for a symbolInfo if not explictly specified. Determines if the user entered value should be persisted and used the next time a template is selected. Used starting in Visual Studio 2022 17.3

defaultPersistenceScopeName.description: The dafault value for a symbolInfo if not explictly specified. Specifies the scope name of the persisted template option. To avoid conflicts with other templates, treat this like a namespace. Used starting in Visual Studio 2022 17.3

defaultSymbolVisibility.description: Sets the default isVisible for a symbolInfo if not explictly specified. Controls if the parameter is displayed in the IDE. Defaults to false if not specified

disableHttpsSymbol.description: The symbol in the template.json which when set, would cause the template to generate non-https ports and settings

icon.description: The relative file name of the icon to show in the New Project dialog

order.description: The order of the template as shown in the New Project dialog

requiredComponents.description: Required components in order to display this template.

supportsDocker.description: Determines if the checkbox for adding Docker support in the New Project dialog should be visible

symbolInfo.description: Controls display characteristics of symbols declared in template.json

tags.description: Modifigy the project and platform tags displayed in the IDE

unsupportedHosts.description: Unsuppored Hosts. This can be used to supress the template from being displayed in the new project dialog in Visual Studio.
